author: cbs8
title: Walk Safely on Icy Surfaces With the DOYS - Designed by InventHelp Client (SAH-845)
text:
InventHelp, a Pittsburgh-based invention firm, is submitting DOY's to companies in the hopes of a good faith review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 25, 2015
After seeing and hearing of so many people slipping on some ice, an inventor from Stockton, Calif., decided to design something to prevent this dangerous accident from happening again.
The patent-pending DOY'S was the result of his brainstorming. This invention enables a user to walk more safely on icy surfaces. This will help to avoid slips, falls and injuries, which promotes safety and peace of mind. It's also ideal for people who work around[in] other slippery environments [kitchens].
The original design was submitted to the Sacramento office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-SAH-845, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
